result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jaylin J Curry

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Corey R. Flynn appeared by video for Jaylin J Curry.  Prosecuting attorney M Samir Siddique in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.  Court waived the defendant's appearance for reasons stated on the record. Defense requests final pretrial and jury trial dates.  Court orders all pretrial documents due on the final pretrial date.  Court grants request.  Case adjourned to Branch 30.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 18, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jaylin J Curry appeared by video.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn appeared by video for Jaylin J Curry.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. State sent over discovery and offer to Defense. Case may be in DPA posture. TAD evaluation to be scheduled.
Case adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 8/17/22. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Jaylin J Curry in court.   Madeline Witte, under the student practice rule, appeared with A.D.A.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 30 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 08/15/2022@2:30p
